subject: Athletics and Sports
Baseball
lead_paragraph: Arizona infielder Donnie Sadler was suspended for 50 games yesterday after testing positive for a drug of abuse under baseball’s minor league program. Sadler, 32, has played for Boston, Cincinnati, Kansas City, Texas and Arizona in eight major league seasons. He is the 20th player suspended this year under the minor league program, the sixth for a drug of abuse.
